intro: Urophyllum annobonense, commonly known as the Annobon Island euphorbia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Annobon in the Gulf of Guinea. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its succulent stems and leaves, which are adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. Urophyllum annobonense is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
